ygData.subject: Re: Languages
ygData.msgSnippet: Dark Speech is differant from Elder Tier Dal. Sumdar - Dark Elf Necromancer of the 4th Circle (well if the rest of the day goes well) Rodcet Nife Server
ygData.messageBody:
Dark Speech is differant from Elder Tier'Dal.


Sumdar - Dark Elf Necromancer of the 4th Circle (well if the rest of the day goes well)
Rodcet Nife Server


*********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********

On 5/17/99 at 7:04 PM Anubis wrote:

>From: Anubis <anubis@...>
>
>Speaking of which...
>
>I was going to travel with some friends of higher level (L11 ranger, L15 monk, I'm L8 enchanter) to
>freeport in an effort to sell a few things (Silver Carnelian wedding rings anyone?) and try and get an
>enchant silver spell.
>
>I was getting tired, and the monk and I were waiting around for the ranger to finish. We decided to
>spam eachother a few times with /g in an effort to learn languages. It seems he had been practicing
>a LOT.
>
>I now have:
>
>Ogre
>Halfling
>Gnomish
>Barbarian
>Troll
>Dark Speech (Elder Tier'Dal? That's what he said it is.)
>
>in addition to the Erudin and Old Erudin that I already have.
>
>I didn't have to zone, but I did logout/login to see the changes.
>
>"Your language skills have increased."
>
>- Aari, Erudite Enchanter on Karana
>
>On Monday, May 10, 1999 7:28 PM, John "Spyke" Alexander [SMTP:spykealpha@...] wrote:
>> From: "John \"Spyke\" Alexander" <spykealpha@...>
>>
>> > why do you have to zone when learning languages? i have never had to zone
>> > when spamming and i learn just fine
>>
>> It seems to help, and the information under "skills" doesn't update unless
>> you zone.
>>
>> We know that they still go up... I went from having nothing in halfing, to
>> almost excellent, and it wasn't in my skills list. I zoned, and it
>> appeared.
>>
>> But, regardless... when two people that aren't "excellent" in a language are
>> trying to teach each other, it seems to help more (i.e. you seem to gain
>> more language levels more quickly) by zoning... as per what Sonoroud said.
>>
>> -Spyke
>>
>>

>> http://www.onelist.com

>
